title: Worked Solution
text:
To solve this, we need to find the ratio of the number of neutrons to protons in the nucleus of a 145Pm (Promethium) atom.

$$1$$. Atomic number (Z) of Promethium (Pm):
Promethium has an atomic number of $$61$$. This means that a 145Pm nucleus has $$61$$ protons.

$$2$$. Mass number (A) of 145Pm:
The mass number (145) represents the total number of protons and neutrons combined.

$$3$$. Number of neutrons (N):
The number of neutrons is given by the difference between the mass number and the atomic number:

N $$=$$ A - Z $$=$$ $$145$$ - $$61$$ $$=$$ $$84$$ 	ext{ neutrons}.

$$4$$. Ratio of neutrons to protons:
The ratio of neutrons to protons is:

Ratio $$=$$ $$ rac{	ext{Neutrons}}{	ext{Protons}$$} $$=$$ $$ rac{84}{61}.$$

Thus, the ratio of neutrons to protons in a 145Pm nucleus is $$ rac{84}{61}$$ or approximately $$1.38$$.
